Title: Data Analyst V
Description:
Position: Werb Analytics Manager

Location: San Francisco, California

Duration: Contract (08/01/2025 to 01/30/2026)

Job ID: 168849



Job Overview:

We are seeking a strategic and hands-on Data Analyst V to join our Data Enablement team. This role focuses on web and agentic analytics, transforming complex behavioral data into actionable insights that drive marketing strategies and product decisions. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in analytics, project management, and stakeholder collaboration, with a proven ability to deliver high-quality insights and reporting frameworks. This position requires working on-site approximately three days per week in San Francisco, California, with a preference for candidates based on the West Coast to align with the team.



Responsibilities:






Analytics & Insights:








Perform deep-dive analyses into web and agentic user behavior to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization.


Translate complex data into clear, compelling stories for cross-functional teams and executives.


Partner with engineering and data teams to ensure high data quality, accurate tracking, and consistent metrics.







Reporting & Visualization:








Build and maintain reporting frameworks, dashboards, and KPIs for marketing, growth, and executive audiences.


Lead automation of recurring reports and contribute to scalable reporting solutions.


Ensure data quality and consistency in pipelines feeding the marketing data warehouse.


Project & Stakeholder Management:







Coordinate and track projects across data ingestion, analytics, and reporting workstreams.


Serve as the point of contact for stakeholder needs, helping prioritize requests and align work with business objectives.


Drive cross-functional communication and alignment through regular updates, documentation, and presentations.


Partner with stakeholders across Marketing, Product, Engineering, and GTM to define priorities and roadmap.


Agile/Scrum Collaboration:







Own the definition of user stories and acceptance criteria informed by the product roadmap.


Provide review and testing for work completed by the engineering team.


Work closely with the scrum lead to ensure the engineering team is well-informed of new work and enabled to succeed.


Leadership & Influence:







Act as a thought partner within the team and with key partners across Marketing, Product, and Engineering.


Interface with executive leadership on a regular and ad hoc basis.


Serve as a subject matter expert on web and agentic analytics, enabling data literacy and adoption across teams.

Qualifications:



7-10+ years of experience in analytics, data strategy, or related roles, ideally in marketing or product analytics.


Strong SQL skills and experience working with large-scale data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, BigQuery).


Familiarity with web analytics tools (e.g., GA4, Adobe Analytics) and event-based tracking frameworks.


Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau preferred).


Proven ability to manage complex projects and prioritize across multiple stakeholders, ideally within Agile frameworks and tools.


Excellent communication and storytelling skills - able to turn data into strategy and insight into action.


Bonus: Experience working with AI/agentic interfaces or conversational data analytics.






 





About PTR Global: PTR Global is a leading provider of information technology and workforce solutions. PTR Global has become one of the largest providers in its industry, with over 5000 professionals providing services across the U.S. and Canada. For more information visit www.ptrglobal.com





At PTR Global, we understand the importance of your privacy and security. We NEVER ASK job applicants to:






Pay any fee to be considered for, submitted to, or selected for any opportunity.


Purchase any product, service, or gift cards from us or for us as part of an application, interview, or selection process.


Provide sensitive financial information such as credit card numbers or banking information. Successfully placed or hired candidates would only be asked for banking details after accepting an offer from us during our official onboarding processes as part of payroll setup.






Pay Range: $70 - $75



The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision and 401K contributions as well as any other PTO, sick leave, and other benefits mandated by appliable state or localities where you reside or work.





If you receive a suspicious message, email, or phone call claiming to be from PTR Global do not respond or click on any links. Instead, contact us directly at +1 214-740-2424. To report any concerns, please email us at legal@pinnacle1.com

Title: Root Cause Analysis (RCA) Analyst I - 25-141
Description:
We’re delighted you’re considering joining us!

At Hill Physicians Medical Group, we’re shaping the healthcare of the future: actively managed care that prevents disease, supports those with chronic conditions and anticipates the needs of our members.

Join Our Team!

Hill Physicians has much to offer prospective employees. We’re regularly recognized as one of the “Best Places to Work in the Bay Area” and have been recognized as one of the “Healthiest Places to Work in the Bay Area.” When you join our team, you’re making a great choice for your professional career and your personal satisfaction.

DE&I Statement:

At PriMed, your uniqueness is valued, celebrated, encouraged, supported, and embraced. Whatever your relationship with Hill Physicians, we welcome ALL that you are.

We value and respect your race, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, disabilities, experiences, perspectives, and other attributes. Our celebration of diversity and foundation of inclusion allows us to leverage our differences and capitalize on our similarities to better serve our communities. We do it because it's right!

Job Description:

Under the leadership of the IT Change Manager, the RCA Analysts’ primary role is to have a detailed knowledge and analytical mind set to perform IT Root Cause Analysis (RCA). Will lead root cause investigations for high-impact incidents and recurring issues across IT systems, clinical applications, and infrastructure. Will Collaborate with incident management, Service Desk, clinical application support, engineering teams, and vendors to identify, isolate, and resolve root causes. Produce detailed RCA reports, including timelines, root causes, corrective actions, and preventive recommendations. Facilitate post-incident reviews (PIRs) with IT leadership, and other teams to ensure transparent knowledge sharing and continuous improvement. Maintain RCA documentation in alignment with ITIL and healthcare quality standards. Develop and report metrics for RCA effectiveness, highlighting trends in recurring problems, system performance, and incident reduction. Contribute to continual service improvement (CSI) initiatives and promote a culture of initiative-taking problem solving. Ensure compliance with ITIL standards and alignment with organizational change and incident management processes.

Specialization

Meticulous IT Root Cause Analysis (RCA) identifies, documents, and helps eliminate the causes of critical IT incidents. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve system reliability, reduce repeat incidents, and ensure compliance with incident management standards.

Job Responsibilities:


Lead root cause analysis investigations for high-impact incidents and recurring issues across IT systems, applications, and infrastructure.
Collaborate with incident management, Service Desk, clinical application support, engineering teams, and vendors to identify, isolate, and resolve root causes.
Produce detailed RCA reports, including timelines, root causes, corrective actions, and preventive recommendations.
Facilitate post-incident reviews (PIRs) with IT leadership, and other teams to ensure transparent knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
Maintain RCA documentation in alignment with ITIL and healthcare quality standards.
Contribute to and maintain a knowledge base of known errors, root causes, and effective resolutions to support organizational learning and faster incident resolution.
Track the implementation and effectiveness of corrective and preventive actions to ensure long-term resolution and risk mitigation.
Develop and report metrics for RCA effectiveness, highlighting trends in recurring problems, system performance, and incident reduction.
Contribute to continual service improvement (CSI) initiatives and promote a culture of proactive problem solving.
Ensure compliance with ITIL standards and alignment with organizational change and incident management processes.
Participate in team and leadership meetings to discuss team and ongoing project related activities, issues, change, communications, and updates.
No supervisory responsibility
Accountable for developing technical skills.
Recognizes when the team needs to be given direction. Proactively looks for feedback to share in their peer’s work and solicits feedback in return.
Provide training and guidance to IT teams on RCA methodologies and best practices to build organizational capability in problem management.



Experience

Required Experience and Professional Skills


1-3 years of experience in the healthcare industry and experience in required RCA discipline



Professional Skills


RCA knowledge
Strong interpersonal skills
Has basic knowledge of the processes and methods of discipline of RCA
Growing knowledge of the principles in the discipline of RCA
Ability to clearly communicate responses to others' questions.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively with others.
Ability to work independently and function as an integral part of the team.
The ability to gain trust and establish effective relationships with system end users, business unit and vendor counterparts.
Seeking, logically examining, and interpreting information from various sources to determine a problem's cause and developing a course of action to resolve the problem and to prevent its recurrence bring effective solutions to complex customer problems.
The ability to persevere in difficult situations, overcome obstacles, and reach high levels of performance when faced with stressful work situations and time pressures.
The willingness to put forth extra effort when required, including demonstrating persistence in the face of obstacles and adversity.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills are both technical and business focused.
The ability to communicate information clearly and concisely with leadership and subject matter experts



Required Education And Certifications

Education


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in information technology, Health Informatics, or a related field.
Familiarity with clinical workflows, EHR/EMR systems (e.g., Epic, Cerner), and healthcare regulatory environments. Epic Experience preferred
Proficient in root cause methodologies (e.g., 5 Whys, Fishbone/Ishikawa, Fault Tree Analysis).



Certifications


ITIL Foundation or Practitioner certification.
Experience with ServiceNow, Remedy, or other ITSM platforms.
Understanding of HL7, FHIR, or other health data exchange protocols preferred.



Additional Information:

Salary: $110,000 - $130,000 Annual

Job Description:

Under the leadership of the IT Change Manager, the RCA Analysts’ primary role is to have a detailed knowledge and analytical mind set to perform IT Root Cause Analysis (RCA). Will lead root cause investigations for high-impact incidents and recurring issues across IT systems, clinical applications, and infrastructure. Will Collaborate with incident management, Service Desk, clinical application support, engineering teams, and vendors to identify, isolate, and resolve root causes. Produce detailed RCA reports, including timelines, root causes, corrective actions, and preventive recommendations. Facilitate post-incident reviews (PIRs) with IT leadership, and other teams to ensure transparent knowledge sharing and continuous improvement. Maintain RCA documentation in alignment with ITIL and healthcare quality standards. Develop and report metrics for RCA effectiveness, highlighting trends in recurring problems, system performance, and incident reduction. Contribute to continual service improvement (CSI) initiatives and promote a culture of initiative-taking problem solving. Ensure compliance with ITIL standards and alignment with organizational change and incident management processes.

Specialization

Meticulous IT Root Cause Analysis (RCA) identifies, documents, and helps eliminate the causes of critical IT incidents. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve system reliability, reduce repeat incidents, and ensure compliance with incident management standards.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Lead root cause analysis investigations for high-impact incidents and recurring issues across IT systems, applications, and infrastructure.
  • Collaborate with incident management, Service Desk, clinical application support, engineering teams, and vendors to identify, isolate, and resolve root causes.
  • Produce detailed RCA reports, including timelines, root causes, corrective actions, and preventive recommendations.
  • Facilitate post-incident reviews (PIRs) with IT leadership, and other teams to ensure transparent knowledge sharing and continuous improvement.
  • Maintain RCA documentation in alignment with ITIL and healthcare quality standards.
  • Contribute to and maintain a knowledge base of known errors, root causes, and effective resolutions to support organizational learning and faster incident resolution.
  • Track the implementation and effectiveness of corrective and preventive actions to ensure long-term resolution and risk mitigation.
  • Develop and report metrics for RCA effectiveness, highlighting trends in recurring problems, system performance, and incident reduction.
  • Contribute to continual service improvement (CSI) initiatives and promote a culture of proactive problem solving.
  • Ensure compliance with ITIL standards and alignment with organizational change and incident management processes.
  • Participate in team and leadership meetings to discuss team and ongoing project related activities, issues, change, communications, and updates.
  • No supervisory responsibility
  • Accountable for developing technical skills.
  • Recognizes when the team needs to be given direction. Proactively looks for feedback to share in their peer’s work and solicits feedback in return.
  • Provide training and guidance to IT teams on RCA methodologies and best practices to build organizational capability in problem management.


Experience

Required Experience and Professional Skills

  • 1-3 years of experience in the healthcare industry and experience in required RCA discipline


Professional Skills

  • RCA knowledge
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Has basic knowledge of the processes and methods of discipline of RCA
  • Growing knowledge of the principles in the discipline of RCA
  • Ability to clearly communicate responses to others' questions.
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with others.
  • Ability to work independently and function as an integral part of the team.
  • The ability to gain trust and establish effective relationships with system end users, business unit and vendor counterparts.
  • Seeking, logically examining, and interpreting information from various sources to determine a problem's cause and developing a course of action to resolve the problem and to prevent its recurrence bring effective solutions to complex customer problems.
  • The ability to persevere in difficult situations, overcome obstacles, and reach high levels of performance when faced with stressful work situations and time pressures.
  • The willingness to put forth extra effort when required, including demonstrating persistence in the face of obstacles and adversity.
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills are both technical and business focused.
  • The ability to communicate information clearly and concisely with leadership and subject matter experts


Required Education And Certifications

Education

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in information technology, Health Informatics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with clinical workflows, EHR/EMR systems (e.g., Epic, Cerner), and healthcare regulatory environments. Epic Experience preferred
  • Proficient in root cause methodologies (e.g., 5 Whys, Fishbone/Ishikawa, Fault Tree Analysis).


Certifications

  • ITIL Foundation or Practitioner certification.
  • Experience with ServiceNow, Remedy, or other ITSM platforms.
  • Understanding of HL7, FHIR, or other health data exchange protocols preferred.


Additional Information:

Salary: $110,000 - $130,000 Annual

Hill Physicians is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Role

World Golf Tour is seeking an Analytics Engineer to join our Product team. In this critical role, you will be the custodian of our data, ensuring it is clean, well-organized, and documented to support strategic business decisions. You will focus on developing and maintaining dashboards and reports for product analytics and user acquisition, collaborating with various teams to provide actionable insights that help operate the business. This role emphasizes strong data stewardship, visualization and statistical analysis.

Responsibilities

Now


Serve as the custodian of data, ensuring data quality, organization and documentation.
Provide clean, transformed data ready for analysis.
Apply software engineering best practices to analytics code (ex: version control, testing, continuous integration).
Maintain data documentation and definitions.
Train business users on how to use data visualization tools.
Collect and evangelize new data sources.
Build dashboards that help the Product and Marketing teams identify new opportunities.
Collaborate with Product, Marketing and other teams to understand their data requirements and translate them into effective reporting solutions


Next


Design and evaluate A/B tests.
Build, deploy and maintain predictive models to optimize player experiences.
Build and maintain game economy models to surface system consequences of product changes.
Build and maintain game growth models that help focus the organization on the best opportunities for growth.


Experience And Skills


Foundational background in statistics (stats101 plus regression analysis)
Proficiency in advanced SQL
Proficiency in statistical programming languages such as R or Python
Demonstrated experience with BI report authoring (PowerBI, Tableau, Looker)
Experience with Product Analytics platforms (Amplitude, Mixpanel)
Experience with MMPs (AppsFlyer, Adjust, Singular).
Familiarity with modern approaches to ETL and ELT (dbt, etc.)
Demonstrated ability to use AI tools opportunistically and carefully as a force multiplier.


Bonus Skills


Familiarity with B2C digital product and user acquisition analytics
Knowledge of golf
Knowledge of free-to-play game economics
Advanced software engineering skills


Portfolio and Past Work

We encourage you to share relevant portfolios or past work that showcases your data analytics expertise. This can include, but is not limited to, GitHub repositories, links to dashboards or analyses, or descriptions of past projects.

Compensation Range: $90K - $150K

Title: Environmental Markets Analyst
Description:
DTE is one of the nation’s largest diversified energy companies. Our electric and gas companies have fueled our customer’s homes and Michigan’s progress for more than a century. And as Michigan’s largest source of renewable energy, we’re creating a cleaner, healthier environment to power our future. We’re also serving communities beyond Michigan, where our affiliated businesses offer renewable energy, emission control technologies, and energy services to industries in 19 states. But we’re more than a leading energy company... and working at DTE is more than just a job. At DTE, we take great care of each other and our customers, and we use our energy to be a force for growth and prosperity in our communities. When you join us, you’ll be part of a team that welcomes, recognizes, and celebrates differences, and values everyone’s health, safety, and wellbeing. Are you ready to make that kind of difference? Bring your energy to DTE. Together, we can achieve great things.

Location: San Francisco, CA

Job Summary

DTE’s environmental markets team trades in renewable energy, carbon, and renewable fuels markets across the U.S. The Environmental Markets Analyst would be responsible for research, analysis, and interpretation of data from across these markets. The analyst will the lead the design and maintenance of market models and other programmatic tools designed to support investment and risk analysis and trade execution.

Key Accountabilities


Conduct research and analysis of renewable energy, fuels, and carbon market data and trends.
Design, build, and maintain financial, trading, and supply-demand models for various markets; create forecasts to identify trading opportunities and support investment decisions.
Collaborate with other teams to identify possible market scenarios and integrate these as sensitivity analyses into various market forecasts.
Work with Operations, Settlements, and Risk teams to maintain and improve proprietary portfolio management programs and tools.
Present analysis and market insights to portfolio managers, management, and risk teams; formats include written, verbal, and PowerPoint.
Performs all other related duties as assigned.


Minimum Education & Experience Requirements


A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university
At least two years of professional experience in renewable fuels, renewable energy, and/or carbon markets
Demonstrable proficiency in data analysis and financial modeling


Other Qualifications

Preferred :


Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely.
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet tight deadlines.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other analytical tools.
Proficiency in R, Python, SQL, VBA, or other statistical languages.
Thorough understanding of North American carbon markets, including, but not limited to, supply and demand, logistics, regulations and operations.
Ability to operate in a fast-paced dynamic commodity market environment, where there are often time constraints and time sensitive deadlines.
Other Requirements:
Ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing.
Ability to work effectively with people at all levels, both within and outside the company.
Ability to handle multiple assignments on a timely basis with a high degree of accuracy.

Physical Demands & Working Conditions

Required

The physical demands characterized here epitomize those that must be met by an employee to properly perform the integral functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. In order to properly perform the integral functions of this job, the employee is required to:


Occasionally stand or walk and stoop or kneel. Frequently, the employee is required to sit.
Talk or hear, both in person and by telephone; use wrists, hands and/or fingers in a repetitive motion; and reach with hands and arms extensively.
Occasionally lift objects of up to 10 pounds in weight
Use computers with exposure to video display terminals; and some repetitive motion associated with data entry, the use of a computer mouse, and while using other office equipment.
Vision requirements for this position include close vision, color vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.


The employee performs job duties primarily in a work from home capacity and periodically from a climate-controlled office environment, with a moderate noise level. However, on an occasional basis the employee may be required to travel to project sites where noise levels and environmental conditions may vary.

Additional Information

Incumbents may engage in all or some combination of the activities and accountabilities and utilize a variety of the competencies cited in this description depending upon the organization and role to which they are assigned. This description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by incumbents in this job. It is not intended as an all-inclusive list of accountabilities or responsibilities, nor is it intended to limit the rights of supervisors or management representatives to assign, direct and control the work of employees under their supervision.

PRIVACY NOTICE TO CALIFORNIA JOB APPLICANTS

At DTE Energy, we are committed to providing an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and a sense of belonging. We seek individuals with a heart for service, a passion to help our communities prosper, and ideas to help shape the future of energy. We are proud to be an equal opportunity, employer that considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, disability, national origin, citizenship, height, weight, genetic information, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable federal and/or state laws.

Title: EXPERT DELEGATO LAVORI (IT)
HTML:
Job Description

Come Expert Delegato Lavori, entrerai in Eni Rewind S.p.A. In particolare, il team Program Manager Nord si occupa della gestione e del coordinamento di interventi di bonifica ambientale di elevata complessità e rilevanza strategica nel nord Italia. Le attività includono il risanamento di suolo, sottosuolo e acque sotterranee, dalla progettazione alla realizzazione e collaudo, la costruzione e la gestione di impianti di trattamento, il decommissioning di aree industriali e il monitoraggio ambientale, nonché la progettazione e il coordinamento di grandi opere civili a supporto degli interventi sul territorio. Operiamo in tutti questi ambiti con un approccio integrato, adottando standard tecnici elevati e garantendo i più alti livelli di tutela in materia di salute, sicurezza, qualità e ambiente.

Attività Principali

  • Supervisionare e coordinare il lavoro di terzi (subcontractors, fornitori etc.) garantendo il monitoraggio dello stato avanzamento dei lavori;
  • Verificare ed approvare la documentazione relativa alle attività di consuntivazione, il tutto in coerenza con i programmi lavori approvati e le autorizzazioni vigenti in stretto coordinamento con il project construction manager;
  • Elaborare i piani e i programmi per la realizzazione delle fasi di collaudo e verifica dei lavori realizzati;
  • Applicare e verificare i requisiti HSE e di qualità;
  • Assicurare la corretta gestione dei contratti post-assegnazione;
  • Garantire la corretta raccolta ed archiviazione documentale, sia rispetto ai progetti ed alle opere, sia per quanto riguarda i dati di monitoraggio.

Caratteristiche Richieste

  • Laurea magistrale in Ingegneria o Geologia; potranno essere presi in considerazione titoli e ambiti di studio differenti o inferiori a fronte di un’esperienza significativa nel ruolo;
  • Esperienza di almeno 3 anni nel settore della gestione delle attività ambientali, con particolare riferimento agli interventi di bonifica e/o messa in sicurezza dei siti contaminati;
  • Ottima conoscenza della normativa ambientale di settore;
  • Ottimo utilizzo degli strumenti informatici più diffusi (word, excel, etc.); la conoscenza SAP costituisce un plus;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese;
  • Disponibilità alla mobilità nazionale ed internazionale.

Completano Il Profilo

  • Costituisce un plus aver maturato esperienza in ambito di cantieri di bonifica di grandi dimensioni.

Sede

Pieve Vergonte (VB), Sannazzaro de' Burgondi (PV)

Proponiamo

  • Contratto di lavoro a Tempo Indeterminato; il nostro contratto collettivo nazionale di lavoro di riferimento è il CCNL Energia e Petrolio
  • Retribuzione commisurata all’esperienza della persona
  • Sistema di reward e programma articolato di benefits ed iniziative di welfare Scopri di più: link welfare
  • Ambiente di lavoro in cui ognuno possa sentirsi riconosciuto e apprezzato nella propria unicità

I candidati ritenuti di maggior interesse saranno contattati per le fasi successive.

Per informazioni sul processo di selezione e consigli utili puoi cliccare qui .

Chi Siamo

Eni Rewind , è la società di Eni che si occupa di risanamento ambientale e fornisce un servizio integrato attraverso diverse fasi di intervento: dalle analisi preliminari, alla progettazione, all’esecuzione degli interventi, alla gestione dei rifiuti, al monitoraggio, fino alla riqualificazione dell’area per nuovi utilizzi. Dalla sua costituzione si è sempre più specializzata nei servizi a favore dell’ambiente, fino a diventare il centro di eccellenza Eni nel risanamento ambientale. Oggi Eni Rewind è una società con un’anima sempre più green, che può contare su tecnologie sostenibili e innovative per la gestione di suolo, acqua e rifiuti e per la tutela dell’ambiente e delle persone.

Title: Junior Process Food Technologist
Description:
Company: IRCA Group is a leading international B2B provider of semi-finished ingredients for the bakery, pastry, and gelato markets. Our products cater to independent producers as well as large food manufacturers. We produce chocolate, decorations, creams, inclusions, pastry mixes, gelato ingredients, and other bakery/pastry essentials. Headquartered in Italy, IRCA Group boasts a strong track record of growth over the past decade, with 22 manufacturing facilities all over the world, 2000+ employee and €1 billion of revenues.




What we offer: IRCA fosters a dynamic environment, embracing diversity and valuing diverse perspectives and international experiences, offering a stimulating context. We promote professional growth by providing tailor-made development programs and career advancement opportunities locally and internationally. With locations worldwide, we offer the chance to work on international projects, collaborate across cultures, and gain a global perspective. Joining our team means becoming part of a global community of passionate professionals dedicated to making a difference. If you are looking for stimulating challenges and the chance to contribute your ideas for process improvement in an ever-growing company, IRCA is the right place.




Purpose of position: We are looking for a passionate and hands-on Junior Process Food Technologist to join our team in a dynamic and growing food manufacturing environment. You will support process optimization and daily operational efficiency in our plant, supporting the industrialization of new sweet products and the optimization of existing processes. This is a great opportunity to grow within a structured and supportive environment while gaining real-world experience in the food industry.




Key Responsibilities
Support the industrialization of new products, collaborating closely with R&D to translate lab-scale formulations into full-scale production
Assist in the design, testing, and validation of new processes and equipment
Collaborate with the Operations team to improve existing manufacturing processes in terms of efficiency, quality, and sustainability
Participate in trials, pilot runs, and technical feasibility studies for product launches and process changes
Ensure the alignment and the update of the production BOMs
Monitor key process parameters
Ensure documentation is up to date (SOPs, technical reports) and support operator training when needed
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Quality, Production, R&D) to implement process improvements





Requirements
Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Food Science & Technologies, or Food Engineering
Professional Skills: Interest in both food product development and manufacturing processes; knowledge of food industrial production processes
Experience: Previous experience in similar roles.
Language Skills: Italian & English (at least B2)
Computer Skills: MS Office
Behavioral Requirements: Hands-on approach, attention to detail, and good problem-solving skills. Collaborative mindset and ability to work in multidisciplinary teams.








We welcome applications from candidates of all genders, backgrounds, identities, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. We believe in equal opportunities for all and ensure that our hiring process complies with the highest standards of non-discrimination and inclusivity. IRCA Group is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone can be their authentic selves, reach their full potential, and feel a true sense of belonging. Join us in creating a workplace where diversity is valued, and everyone can thrive.

 

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ai candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso ai sensi del D.lgs. 198/2006 e ai candidati appartenenti a qualsiasi genere, nel rispetto dei principi di diversità e inclusione e di non discriminazione.

Show more
HTML:
Company: IRCA Group is a leading international B2B provider of semi-finished ingredients for the bakery, pastry, and gelato markets. Our products cater to independent producers as well as large food manufacturers. We produce chocolate, decorations, creams, inclusions, pastry mixes, gelato ingredients, and other bakery/pastry essentials. Headquartered in Italy, IRCA Group boasts a strong track record of growth over the past decade, with 22 manufacturing facilities all over the world, 2000+ employee and €1 billion of revenues.


What we offer: IRCA fosters a dynamic environment, embracing diversity and valuing diverse perspectives and international experiences, offering a stimulating context. We promote professional growth by providing tailor-made development programs and career advancement opportunities locally and internationally. With locations worldwide, we offer the chance to work on international projects, collaborate across cultures, and gain a global perspective. Joining our team means becoming part of a global community of passionate professionals dedicated to making a difference. If you are looking for stimulating challenges and the chance to contribute your ideas for process improvement in an ever-growing company, IRCA is the right place.


Purpose of position: We are looking for a passionate and hands-on Junior Process Food Technologist to join our team in a dynamic and growing food manufacturing environment. You will support process optimization and daily operational efficiency in our plant, supporting the industrialization of new sweet products and the optimization of existing processes. This is a great opportunity to grow within a structured and supportive environment while gaining real-world experience in the food industry.


Key Responsibilities
  • Support the industrialization of new products, collaborating closely with R&D to translate lab-scale formulations into full-scale production
  • Assist in the design, testing, and validation of new processes and equipment
  • Collaborate with the Operations team to improve existing manufacturing processes in terms of efficiency, quality, and sustainability
  • Participate in trials, pilot runs, and technical feasibility studies for product launches and process changes
  • Ensure the alignment and the update of the production BOMs
  • Monitor key process parameters
  • Ensure documentation is up to date (SOPs, technical reports) and support operator training when needed
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Quality, Production, R&D) to implement process improvements


Requirements
  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Food Science & Technologies, or Food Engineering
  • Professional Skills: Interest in both food product development and manufacturing processes; knowledge of food industrial production processes
  • Experience: Previous experience in similar roles.
  • Language Skills: Italian & English (at least B2)
  • Computer Skills: MS Office
  • Behavioral Requirements: Hands-on approach, attention to detail, and good problem-solving skills. Collaborative mindset and ability to work in multidisciplinary teams.



We welcome applications from candidates of all genders, backgrounds, identities, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. IRCA Group is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment where everyone can be their authentic selves, reach their full potential, and feel a true sense of belonging. https://agenziapiemontelavoro.it/centro-per-limpiego/centro-per-limpiego-di-borgomanero

Posizione

Per Azienda Metalmeccanica di Varallo Pombia si cerca per ampliamento organico personale nel ruolo di LAMINATORE e FINITORE.

Si offre contratto di inserimento a tempo indeterminato o determinato a seconda dell'esperienza e preparazione maturata del candidato.

Orario di lavoro: full time, giornata o due turni.


Indispensabile esperienza pregressa nella mansione
Conoscenza lingua italiana


Modalità di invio della candidatura: Visualizza l'annuncio su IOLAVORO, clicca sul pulsante INVIA LA CANDIDATURA e compila il tuo profilo con tutte le informazioni. Requisiti


Esperienza pregressa: DA 1 A 5 ANNI


Altre Informazioni


Luogo di lavoro: Varallo Pombia, Novara, Italia
Tipo di contratto: CONTRATTO A TEMPO INDETERMINATO
Modalità di lavoro: FULL TIME

Title: Data Analyst - Data Analyst I
Description:
Location: Boston, Seaport

Employment Type: 6 Month Contract

Are you a data-driven problem solver with a knack for financial modeling and capacity planning? Join our team as a Data Analyst I and help shape strategic decisions with your analytical expertise.

🔍 What You’ll Do


Analyze financial, economic, and market data to support decision-making.
Support capacity planning, budgeting, and reporting for operating expenses, capital investments, and resource allocation.
Build and manage financial models to forecast business performance and conduct variance analysis.
Collaborate on the design and implementation of tools/systems to support evolving business needs.


🎓 What You Bring:


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or related field. MBA or similar graduate degree preferred.
0–3 years of relevant experience, ideally with exposure to capacity planning or operations.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to develop complex financial models.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; SQL knowledge is a strong plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Detail-oriented, adaptable, and able to work independently in a dynamic environment.


ES2

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What is Cirkul?

Cirkul is a rapidly growing beverage technology company on a mission to make a healthier world by helping people enjoy drinking more water.

The team at Cirkul developed an innovative beverage delivery system that makes drinking more water delicious, fun, and personalized. The technology reduces the shipping weight of bottled beverages by 96% and uses 84% less plastic. Cirkul offers its customers 100+ unique flavors, all with no sugar, zero calories, no artificial colors, and a range of functional enhancements online, at Walmart, and other retailers across the United States. Hundreds of thousands of consumers are using Cirkul to transition from single-use plastics and sugar-filled beverages to healthier, better-for-you alternatives.

What is this role?

As a Data Analyst for Cirkul, you will be tackling challenges across Growth/Marketing, Finance, Retail, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Customer Support teams to quickly deliver insights through analysis, experimentation and reporting. Additionally, you will develop business processes to scale analytics to support a hyper growth business.

The ideal candidate must be able to roll up his/her sleeves to work independently and own delivery results. He/she must have the ability to prioritize issues under manager’s guidance, deal with ambiguity, seek help when needed and manage conflicting deadlines.

What does an average day look like?

Driving Results:


Design and develop KPIs tracking business performance across departments
Build and automate tools to surface key data to stakeholders across a broad range of data literacy levels


Taking Ownership:


Monitor KPIs to identify potential opportunities to improve company performance


Making Decisions:


Collect, analyze, and explain data to key stakeholders and executive leadership


Cultivating Relationships:


Be a data evangelist: collaborate with both technical and non-technical teammates to supplement decisions with quantitative evidence


Instilling Trust:


Always auditing: build and maintain processes to track data and troubleshoot errors


Customer Focus:


Provide ad hoc analysis and forecasting as needed across a diverse set of teams
Evaluate reporting needs and work with key stakeholders to prioritize overall strategy of the data team in answering company goals


What background should you have?


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Finance or equivalent quantitative degree. Master’s preferred
1+ year of experience preferred
Data-driven, detail-oriented individual with excellent analysis and problem-solving abilities
Fluency in data analysis and data-driven problem solving; a track record of using data to communicate results to key stakeholders
Experience with experimentation and statistical analysis
Excellent verbal and written communication skills: the ability to present complex data in a digestible format to stakeholders of all data literacy levels
Fluency with advanced SQL and Python
Comfortable creating dashboards in a BI framework such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, or comparable tools
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously: superb time management and prioritization ability


What do we offer?


Competitive salary based on experience and market
Generous benefits, 401k match, and PTO (even insurance for your fur babies!)
Employee discounts on Cirkul products
New corporate office space with great amenities
Opportunity to work with a best in class team, in a hyper growth company, taking over the hydration industry
A culture that rewards results


Please review our privacy policy here.

Cirkul, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and are committed to sustaining an equitable and inclusive, people-first environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$79,700 - $98,000

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Posting Description

ASSOCIATE DATA ANALYST, Credit Union, supports organization business and department objectives through collecting, evaluating and reporting member and sales data. With guidance from AVP, Data Analytics and Program Support the ADA will help maintain Arkalytics (DataLake), DNA CRM/BI tool and all data related systems to help research trends, support opportunities and measure program effectiveness; proactively support outreach programs through any type of list generation and providing ad-hoc analysis; ensure consistency within the organization in applying a set of projects and process improvement standards; and share knowledge, provide, and serve as resource to project teams and management on tools, methods and best practices.

The Full Job Description Is Available Here.

Job Requirements

REQUIRED: Bachelor’s degree; a minimum of two years of administrative and/or project/program management experience; effective mathematical, language, problem solving, reasoning, writing and basic to complex numeric skills; intermediate to advanced SQL skills for data extraction and analysis; experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel (pivottables, macros, advanced formulas); ability to handle multiple projects and work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment; and excellent typing, interpersonal and organizational skills. Job #25065-6

This hybrid role requires on-site presence. Employees are expected to work 3 days in the office and 2 days remotely each week.

7/11/2025

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Location: Marlborough MA 01752

Onsite Requirements: Hybrid

3+ years of experience in Business Analysis or BI roles, with a focus on Data Warehousing and Power BI.
Proficient in Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service, and Dataflows).
Strong SQL skills and understanding of data modeling (star/snowflake schemas).

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business data requirements.
Design, document, and validate data models and business logic within Data Warehouses.
Build and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations in Power BI.
Translate business questions into technical queries using DAX and SQL.
Perform data profiling, cleansing, and validation to ensure high data quality.
Develop KPIs, metrics, and performance indicators aligned with business goals.
Automate reporting and analysis processes to increase efficiency and accuracy.
Conduct user training and provide ongoing support for Power BI users.
Work closely with data engineers and architects to ensure optimal data structure and ETL performance.
Monitor and troubleshoot data refresh issues and data integrity concerns in Power BI Service.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in Business Analysis or BI roles, with a focus on Data Warehousing and Power BI.
Proficient in Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service, and Dataflows).
Strong SQL skills and understanding of data modeling (star/snowflake schemas).
Hands-on experience working with cloud-based and on-prem data platforms (e.g., Azure Synapse, SQL Server or similar).
Knowledge of ETL processes and tools (SSIS, ADF, or similar)

**3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply.
This position requires candidates to be eligible to work in the United States, directly for an employer, without sponsorship now or anytime in the future**
Show more

  • Perform data profiling, cleansing, and validation to ensure high data quality.
  • Develop KPIs, metrics, and performance indicators aligned with business goals.
  • Automate reporting and analysis processes to increase efficiency and accuracy.
  • Conduct user training and provide ongoing support for Power BI users.
  • Work closely with data engineers and architects to ensure optimal data structure and ETL performance.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot data refresh issues and data integrity concerns in Power BI Service.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in Business Analysis or BI roles, with a focus on Data Warehousing and Power BI.
  • Proficient in Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service, and Dataflows).
  • Strong SQL skills and understanding of data modeling (star/snowflake schemas).
  • Hands-on experience working with cloud-based and on-prem data platforms (e.g., Azure Synapse, SQL Server or similar).
  • Knowledge of ETL processes and tools (SSIS, ADF, or similar)

  • **3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply.
  • This position requires candidates to be eligible to work in the United States, directly for an employer, without sponsorship now or anytime in the future**

Title: Insight Data Analyst
Description:
Your role at Dynatrace

As a Data Analytics Consultant II, you’ll work with some of the largest sites on the web across major industries (retail, auto, finance, travel, etc.) and help to answer questions about site performance and user engagement, which drives improved customer experience for their customers and improves the client’s overall business.

Dynatrace’s tools generate mountains of data, a lot of which clients don’t know how to make use of…that’s where you come in. You will turn that mountain of data into invaluable insight. As someone who lives and breathes data, analysis and problem solving, you will help your clients understand the right performance data, in the right context. You’ll turn that data into business altering insight which enables your client to take the right action to improve overall site performance and user experience that maximizes business outcomes.

You will help clients set a strategy for how they can optimize both their current performance and build performance into their culture. Responsibilities include:


Account management for up to 8 clients, including managing the relationship and customer expectations, providing value and helping to grow your accounts; running all customer touchpoint meetings
Working as an extension of your client's team and the Dynatrace product through ad-hoc analysis, testing initiatives, configuring Dynatrace offerings to get to answers faster, and training and enablement
Creating detailed analysis for your clients by finding answers from the Digital Experience and Business Analytics data through reporting, dashboarding, or technology expertise
Representing your client within the rest of Dynatrace for Digital Experience Monitoring (DEM) issues
Additional responsibilities include working with our team to improve process, identify training gaps and share ideas


What Will Help You Succeed

Minimum Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or other quantitative disciplines is required.
3- 5 years of experience with data analysis, including looking at and distilling complex sets of data and presenting findings in an engaging way


Preferred Requirements:


Experience in data driven analysis - excellent at working with, understanding, analyzing data
Strong understanding of web technologies including HTML, JS, CSS, networking, Content Delivery Networks, Cloud; basic understanding of Chrome Dev and Webpage test
Proficient with analysis tools including Google Analytics, Adobe, Advanced Excel, Tableau, SPSS, R, etc.
Stellar conceptualization and communication skills. Demonstrated ability to bring business and technical people together around clear product concepts, and to motivate them to deliver whole, working solutions
Operates with a customer first focus
Proven ability to work under pressure and to handle multiple conflicting priorities
Recognizes and understands both personal and team dynamics and relationships, is empathetic to stakeholder concerns and effectively influences and persuades
Thinks proactively and tries to develop solutions rather than wait for an answer
Has a desire to learn new technology and deliver successful customer and partner outcomes for stakeholders at all levels
Possesses excellent organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail


Expectation: all Insights team members are expected to travel at least 1 time per year for annual team meetings.

Why you will love being a Dynatracer


A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset with Dynatracers from different countries & cultures all over the world, and English as the corporate language that connects us all
A culture that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.

Please review the Dynatrace privacy policy here: https://www.dynatrace.com/company/trust-center/policies/recruitment-privacy-notice

Title: Market Data Associate
Description:
Bain Capital Overview

With approximately $185 billion of assets under management, Bain Capital is one of the world’s leading private investment firms. We create lasting impact for our investors, teams, businesses, and the communities in which we live. Over four decades we have strategically grown our platform to focus on Private Equity, Growth & Venture, Capital Solutions, Credit & Capital Markets, and Real Assets. Today, our team includes 1,880+ employees in 24 offices on four continents.

We partner differently to help people and companies embrace possibility and realize potential. Founded as a private partnership in 1984, we have fostered a culture of innovation, entrepreneurialism, and agility, empowering our people to define and own their career trajectories. Today, our partnership approach enables us to pursue strategic growth, build enduring relationships with a robust external network, and collaborate across our integrated platform to connect the deep and diverse expertise that unlocks breakthrough insights.

Our people are the heart of our advantage. Colleagues at all levels have a seat at the table as they tackle business challenges with a principal investor mindset. By asking incisive questions, respectfully challenging one another, and remaining intellectually agile, we work together to achieve exceptional outcomes.

For more information visit: Bain Capital.

DESCRIPTION:

The Market Data Associate reports directly to the Market Data Director in the Research & Market Data Services (RDS) department within Platform Services at Bain Capital. Our team provides best-in-class market data services and enables innovated research solutions globally for all investment teams and assets classes across the firm. This includes but is not limited to 3rd party data & research procurement, firmwide access & budget management, vendor selection & onboarding, contract negotiations, vendor risk, and partnering with the broader RDS Research team to support the investment due diligence process. You will be working directly with multiple investment teams, Finance, Legal, IT & Compliance stakeholders, and the RDS global research team in a fast-paced complex environment. This position is critical for maximizing the value of our market data & delivery of research services globally at the firm.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Lead onboarding/offboarding of market data and research services ensuring investment team access needs are supported and issues are resolved in a timely manner. Requires coordination with vendors, internal end-users, internal IT and oversight of outsourced business operation teams supporting workflows.
Serve as a project manager involving key market data initiatives & strategic research projects, e.g. establishing access to research services via OKTA.
Manage RDS internal communications for new hirers regarding access needs.
Responsible for inventory data quality control & license cost allocations in FITS system for budget reporting.
Provide input on market data and research best practices & policies and procurement procedures.


QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS:


Excellent attention to detail, organizational abilities, project management, and problem-solving skills are critical.
Strong written and verbal communication is required, with the ability to communicate clearly across different audiences globally.
Able to work efficiently in a high-paced environment, and deal with frequent changes or unexpected events while providing a high level of customer service.
Comfortable with ambiguity and enjoy managing multiple projects and complex workflows.
Manage time effectively, multi-task, and meet deadlines with quality and consistency.
Minimum of 1-3 years working in a market data and/or project management role.
Strong Excel skills are necessary.
Undergraduate degree from a respected institution required.
Eager to learn and innovate.


Bain Capital is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Show more

Title: Operations Data Analyst
Description:
Financial Analyst

Hybrid, Framingham, MA

Project at least 6 months



Hourly rate: $35.00-40.00/hr



Must have:

Bachelors degree

3-8 years of experience in a Financial Analyst position

Power BI, specifically creating dashboards

Excel - Look ups, pivot tables, formulas



Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Financial Analyst to join our National Operations Team. This role focuses on enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of our reporting processes that directly support field and local teams.



Responsibilities:

-Collaborate with various business partners to gather data from multiple datasets.

-Identify new reporting opportunities and develop reports based on business requirements.

-Design insightful reports and databases to facilitate data-driven decision-making.

-Provide training to end users on how to effectively utilize reporting tools.

-Document the process flow of reporting procedures for clarity and consistency.

-Demonstrate proficiency in data analysis, identifying correlations, and translating insights into actionable operational and financial controls.

-Manage special projects and additional responsibilities as assigned.

-Support ad-hoc reporting requests as necessary.

-Work closely with the business to enhance data collection methods and ensure data quality.





#AFHR

Title: Data Operations & Reporting Analyst - Strategy & Analytics
Description:
About Cartesian:

Cartesian is a specialist consulting firm with 35+ years of experience serving the global TMT (telecommunications, media, and technology) sectors. We help clients solve complex problems and drive performance through practical strategies, data-driven transformations, and tech solutions. Our work spans analytics, strategy, management consulting, technical services, and content security.




About the Team:

Our Strategy & Analytics team partners with companies and investors in the technology, media, and telecommunications (TMT) sector to uncover opportunities and drive performance. We combine strategic thinking, deep data insights, and technical expertise to tackle critical challenges across our clients’ organizations. Our work spans branding and marketing strategy, sales optimization, operational efficiency, policy and regulatory analysis, financial modeling, data science, and more. We’re a team of smart, curious, and collaborative individuals from diverse backgrounds, united by a shared passion for solving complex, ambiguous problems in an ever-evolving world.




What You’ll Do:

As a Data Analyst, you’ll work on 2–5-person project teams to design and manage complex data workflows. You’ll build and maintain ETL pipelines, ensure data integrity, automate processes, and deliver dashboards, reports, and predictive analytics tailored to client needs. You’ll translate data into clear, actionable insights in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




What You’ll Bring

0–3 years of relevant experience in a data operations or analytics role
Bachelor’s degree with a preference for quantitative course work
Exposure to programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL, for analytics and reporting
Proficiency with Excel
Passion for problem-solving and working with data
Strong organizational and communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate plans and maintain well-documented data processes
Effective time management skills and the ability to proactively set and execute priorities
Interest in managing large data environments and reporting processes (for tenured applicants, experience is strongly preferred)
Interest in developing and managing ETL pipelines with a strong focus on data integrity and quality control (for tenured applicants, experience is strongly preferred)
Passion for presenting data in a compelling way that tells a clear story




Additional Skills We Value

Exposure to frontend web development technologies like React, or Node.js
Experience working on projects in the TMT (Technology, Media, & Telecommunications) industry
Familiarity with cloud-based platforms like AWS, Azure, Google Cloud (GCP), Databricks, and/or Snowflake
Exposure to data visualization tools such as Alteryx, Power BI, Tableau, and/or QGIS
Ability to produce and present client-ready, executive-level deliverables




What We Offer

Competitive compensation and performance-based bonuses
Learning & development programs and mentorship
Exposure to high-impact projects
Volunteer events that support giving back to our local communities
Weekly company-sponsored team social
Annual summer party, holiday party, and other fun events




Employment Type

Full-time | Hybrid | Boston, MA




This position has low travel requirements for most engagements; however, this can vary depending on client needs.




Cartesian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace and do not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to be a part of the clean energy movement? Are you passionate about improving our environment for this generation and those to follow? Are you ready to take on new challenges and collaborate with a future-focused team leading the way into new markets? Join Nexamp! 

This is where you can learn from industry leaders and become one yourself. It's fast-paced, mission-based work that challenges the status quo. Be on the team that's changing the world. 

What we’re looking for: 

We're looking for a Lead Data Analyst to craft insightful and compelling data stories, empower business owners across Nexamp to make more effective data-driven decisions, and help build our self-service data platform. As one of the nation’s largest and longest tenured solar and storage owner operators – and one of the few that is fully vertically integrated – our data is a differentiator in the market and a catalyst for future growth. You’ll be solving uniquely challenging data problems, alongside a strong team, and for a company in which the business model and mission are inseparably intertwined: our solar farms save customers money, help the planet, and are profitable for Nexamp and its investors. 

This role will be hybrid, based out of our Boston office, and you will report to the Director of Product, Data.

What you’ll do:  

Own and Deliver Data Products: Independently gather requirements for, prioritize, deliver, maintain, and continuously improve reusable data models, dashboards, analyses, A/B tests, and other data assets. Act as the product manager and implementer for your domain’s data offerings. Implement work using advanced SQL and BI tool skills. 
Be a Trusted Data Partner: Become the subject matter expert for data in your business areas. Identify opportunities for impact, proactively surface insights, support decision-making, and contribute to and influence business strategy and initiatives. Serve as your business stakeholders’ right hand. Support other business areas opportunistically.
Drive Data Quality, Documentation, and Engineering: Create and maintain comprehensive data documentation and communicate updates to your stakeholders. Write user stories or tickets for data engineering, validate data mapping, conduct QA, and implement data quality monitoring.
Foster Data Culture and Adoption: Monitor the usage of data assets, increase data literacy, and promote self-service through BI tools among stakeholders. Provide training, guidance, and support as needed.  
Collaborate Across the Data Team: Work within a centralized data team using agile methodologies. Collaborate with peer analysts through overlapping work, priority shifting, and code reviews to broaden your Nexamp knowledge.
Influence Data Strategy: Partner with the data architect, engineers, scientists, and analysts to shape the vision and roadmap for Nexamp’s data platform. Define and track annual OKRs to measure your impact.  

What you’ll bring: 

5-7 years of experience as a data analyst serving business owners and collaborating with data engineers (experience in the energy/construction industry is a plus, but not required) 
Advanced in SQL and BI tool administration and usage (experience with Databricks and Sigma are a plus, but not required) 
Strong track record of independently solving problems.
Commitment to Nexamp's mission and have a passion for solving tomorrow's climate crisis today.
Demonstrated experience in effectively communicating information, ideas, and perspectives with people inside and beyond your organization.   
Experience in showcasing initiative to make improvements to current work, processes, products, and services across the organization. We value accountability and an ownership mentality. 
Ability to ask appropriate questions, analyze data, identify the root causes of problems, and present creative solutions. 
Expertise in building strong internal and external relationships with customers and stakeholders, instilling trust and loyalty across the industry. 
Eagerness to develop a fundamental understanding of how Nexamp operates and then apply that knowledge effectively to inform business decisions.  

If you don’t meet 100% of the above qualifications, but see yourself contributing, please apply.

At Nexamp, our mission is to build the future of energy so it is clean, simple, and accessible for all. We are committed to providing a work environment free from discrimination. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against applicants on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. By encouraging a culture where ideas and decisions come from all people, we believe it will help us grow, innovate, and be a part of environmental and social change.

You’ll love working here because:  

Not only will you get to take part in meaningful work and have the chance to change the world alongside innovative, dedicated, and motivated peers, but you will also have access to all the benefits that Nexamp offers! This includes our competitive compensation package; a 401(k) employer-match; health, dental, and vision insurance starting day one; flexible paid time off and holiday PTO; commuter benefits, and cell phone reimbursement. We have headquarters in Boston, MA and Chicago, IL, in addition to growing offices nationwide. We provide healthy snacks, coffee, service days and other volunteer opportunities, company outings, and more!  

Nexamp's People team manages all aspects of recruitment and hiring within our organization. We want to inform third-party recruiters, staffing firms, and related agencies that Nexamp does not accept unsolicited resumes. Resumes will only be considered from these entities if a signed agreement is in place and the People team explicitly authorizes external recruiting assistance for a specific position. Any unsolicited resumes received will be deemed the property of Nexamp. We want to emphasize that Nexamp is not liable for any fees associated with unsolicited resumes.
